children.subject: I am transfer student, I think Diablo Valley College should have an online class equivalent to math53, at least when I was there, but you are required to take the final exam in person. For 7A, I am pretty sure there isn't.
I took Physics 7B at cc summer after freshman year; there were daily labs over the six-week period so I think it's relatively unlikely for there to be an online equivalent unfortunately

I did a few, all while in HS.  I took a nutrition class that satisfied Biological Sciences, I took Chinese classes which satisfied International, and took a American Cultures English class which double dipped and satisfied my American Cultures and the Arts and Literature breadth.  They are pretty easily transferable even if you've taken the classes while already enrolled.  Just use assist.org to make sure that the class articulates to a breadth.
Has anyone done online classes from cc to satisfy breadth requirements? Thanks!
Has anyone found a CC equivalent for Physics 7A (in person is ok)?

history.content: Use http://web2.assist.org/web-assist/welcome.html to find equivalents for Berkeley at CCs. I'd recommend finding the viable CCs you could attend this summer for physics, then checking what the equivalent for 7A is, then seeing if it's offered this summer. It looks like it's a bit outdated but you can use the old tool to narrow down your search before using the new one to confirm a course's credit transfer eligibility.

Hi! I am planning on taking an equivalent online class for math 53 and Physics 7A at a community college. Has anyone taken these classes online via a community college? or does anyone know which community college may offer these classes online?
history.subject: Online classes
